title: Marketplace for Thursday, January 15, 2015
byline: Sabri Ben-Achour, Dan Bobkoff, Dan Weissmann, David Gura, Daniel Kibblesmith, Sam Weiner, Amy Scott and Annie Baxter
teaser: Airing on Thursday, January 15, 2015: Big banks are reporting lower revenue, in part because of less trading. Are lower profits for banks, especially from trading, necessarily bad for the economy? Plus, the Swiss franc soared today after Switzerland decided to abandon the cap on the currency value against the euro. We look at what was behind the decision and what difference it will make. Finally, President Obama proposes seven days a year of paid sick leave, arguing that providing more sick leave makes businesses more competitive and workers more productive. We examine the economics of the sick day.
